result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A. Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:Plea and sentencing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:48 PM Defendant Jason A. Smith in court in person with attorney Jason D Sanders in person.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 4 years probation, 6 months jail with huber, costs due within 60 days, and any treatment deemed necessary. Sentence credit 9 days. Count 2 dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:34 PM Defendant Jason A. Smith in court in custody by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Michael Doran sworn in and testified. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects.   Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $500 set with conditions of court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.
